meanings.definition: Loose - not firmly or tightly fixed in place; not compact or dense
meanings.sent1: The shirt felt oose and comfortable.
meanings.sent2: Her hair was oose and flowing in the wind.
meanings.sent3: The oose knot in the rope made it easy to untie.
meanings.sent4: The oose soil allowed the roots to spread easily.
meanings.sent5: The oose sand slipped through his fingers like water.

meanings.definition: Loose - free from restraint or confinement
meanings.sent1: The bird flew oose in the open sky.
meanings.sent2: She felt oose and relaxed after finishing her work.
meanings.sent3: The oose cat stretched lazily in the sun.
meanings.sent4: His mind felt oose and free from worries.
meanings.sent5: The oose kite danced freely in the breeze.

meanings.sent1: Please oose the knot in the rope.
meanings.sent2: He carefully oosed the trapped bird from the net.
meanings.sent3: She tried to oose herself from the tangled mess.
meanings.sent4: The magician oosed himself from the chains effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The key will oose the lock and set you free.

meanings.definition: Loose - to set free or unfasten
meanings.sent1: The zookeeper will oose the animals back into the wild.
meanings.sent2: He decided to oose the fish he caught back into the lake.
meanings.sent3: She had to oose her grip on the handle to open the door.
meanings.sent4: The hero oosed the hostages from their restraints.
meanings.sent5: The sun will oose the ice from the frozen lake.

meanings.definition: Loose - to make less tight or compact
meanings.sent1: She needed to oose the screws to adjust the shelf.
meanings.sent2: The tailor had to oose the dress to make it fit perfectly.
meanings.sent3: He tried to oose the lid of the jar that was stuck.
meanings.sent4: The mechanic had to oose the bolts to access the engine.
meanings.sent5: The warm water will oose the dirt from the fabric.
